subject: Sales
title: Learning From Every Lost Pitch
description: A short lesson to help you apply Learning From Every Lost Pitch.

hook.text: A seller loses three pitches in a row. Most just move on. Winners analyze every loss for patterns.

buildup.text: Lost pitches hold lessons that winning pitches never reveal. Failure is the better teacher.

discovery.text: Review each loss: where did attention drop, what objections arose, and which stakeholder disengaged?

twist.text: Ego resists honest analysis. It's easier to blame the audience than to fix your own performance.

climax.text: Review every pitch within 24 hours. Document what worked and what failed. Patterns will emerge.

punchline.text: The pitcher who reviews every loss improves the fastest.

quiz.question: Why are lost pitches more valuable than wins for learning?
options: They reveal specific failure patterns that wins never expose
